data.title: Apple and Google takes steps to ensure privacy as coronavirus tracking rolls out
data.text: In rolling out their coronavirus tracking system to developers, Apple and Google have confirmed that it will ban location tracking by other official apps. But the decision, which prioritizes privacy and preventing governments from using the system to compile data on citizens, could complicate things for state governments looking to track coronavirus outbreaks.

data.title: Amazon’s vice president resigns citing disappointment in the company’s decision of firing whistle-blowers
